body.div1:
Honorable Assistant Secretary of State Washington, D.C.
Sir: I have the honor to inform the Department of any return May 12th to Basoko from the Lomami River. The following is a brief as count of the manner in which the Arab Slave dealers have been driven from this section of the Kongo Free State.
Upon my arrival at Basoko March2nd Commandant Chaltin informed me he had recieved orders from Inspector of the State, M. Five in the Sankuru River to proceed to Bena- Kamba, in the Lomami River and commence asperations
<pb facs="20170614_144014"
against the Arabs who were supposed to be at that place in large numbers, and if suc- cessful to proceed to Tchari 60 miles farther south occu- py that place, and these re- turn to Bena Kamba, and proceed to Riba-Riba. Nothing was said in This Communication which could be combined into an order to arrack any Arab pasts situated between Isanghi and Kibonge Com- mandant Chatlin invited me to accompany kim, as his guest, but I preferred first to see Stanley Falls under Arab rule, as I had an idea they would revolt in a few months.
I accepted the invitation to come on a Steamer leaving a few weeks after his departure. He left Basoko for Bena- Komba March 7th on board the Steamer "Ville d'anvers" with 200
<pb facs="20170614_144024"
200 Joediers + 2 Krupp 7.5 omm Canon.
The Steamer "Ville de Buxelles" was sent to Equator Station, 500 miles down river to being re-enforcements. I left for Stanley Falls march 4th and remained until March 17th when M.Jobback, The President, Kindly sent me to Basako in the pleau- "launch" A.I.A. in order to cash the "Bruxelles" on her return"
During my stay at the Falls I could see there was a strong feeling amongst the Arabs against the State, and that it only re- quired a very small thing to begin the war against the Govern- ment.
The Vali (or Governor) at the Falls Commonly known as Rachid, but whose real name is Rachid.
